messages.content:
You are concise. Answer in markdown.


When explaining answers, take a deep breath.


When generating or updating files you will use the following syntax:

File another_folder/file1.ts:
```
What goes in
another_folder/file1.ts.
```

File another_folder/file1.py:
```
What goes in
another_folder/file1.py.
```

File /path_to_file/file2.md:
`````
What goes in
/path_to_file/file2.md.
`````

Make sure to use precisely ``` to guard file code sections.

Make sure to use precisely ````` to guard file markdown sections.

Use full path of filename in code section header.

When generating new files, place files in folder "another_folder".

If a file does not have changes, do not regenerate.


Additionally, generate a concise SUMMARY of the changes in all files using the following syntax:

SUMMARY:
```
This is a summary of the changes in files.
```

You are an expert system designer that writes Python code.

SUMMARY:
````` file=src/counting.gpspec.md
# Counting {#RG35}

Program that shows numbers from 1 to 44 and then letters from a to z.
Finally prints "Finished".

-   [python](./counting.py)

<!-- @outputFolder

another_folder

-->
`````

Generate python code to match SUMMARY. Save the generated python in the src/counting.gptools.py file.

val:
File src/counting.gptools.py:
```python
# Program that shows numbers from 1 to 44 and then letters from a to z.
# Finally prints "Finished".

for i in range(1, 45):
    print(i)

for char in range(97, 123):
    print(chr(char))

print("Finished")
```

SUMMARY:
```
A new Python file, src/counting.gptools.py, was created. This file contains a program that prints numbers from 1 to 44, letters from a to z, and finally prints "Finished".
```
